checkers

Class CheckerPiece

  • java.lang.Object
    • general.Piece
      • checkers.CheckerPiece

  • public class CheckerPiece
extends Piece
    Represents a checker, with a Side of the board and a piece Color.

      Stores whether or not this piece is a King.

      • CheckerPiece

        public CheckerPiece(Side s,
                    java.awt.Color c)
        Creates a new Checker and sets the icon and ImageIcon appropriately.
        Parameters:
        s - The Side of the board this piece is on.
        c - The Color of the piece. Currently supported colors are:
        • Black
        • Red

    • Method Detail

      • king

        public void king()
        Changes this piece to a king, updating the icon and ImageIcon appropriately.

      • getMoves

        public java.util.List<int[]> getMoves(Piece[][] board,
                                      int[] current)
        Finds all valid moves for this piece on board.
        A checker can move diagonally forward (away from the Side it started out on) if there is nothing blocking its path. If it is a king, it can move diagonally in all directions. However, if there is a piece of the opposite Color blocking its path in any direction, then it must be jumped over and captured. If any more pieces can be jumped over from there, they must be jumped over as well.
        Specified by:
        getMoves in class Piece
        Parameters:
        board - The board the moves should work on.
        current - The position of this piece, to save time that would be used searching.
        Returns:
        A list of all valid moves as coordinates. If there are multiple stops, each coordinate is appended to the end of the list in order.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if this piece is not at current

      • hasCaptures

        public boolean hasCaptures(Piece[][] board,
                           int[] current)
        Checks if this piece can capture any pieces.
        Parameters:
        board - The board the move should work on.
        current - The position of this piece, to save time that would be used searching.
        Returns:
        Whether or not this piece can make any captures.

      • getCaptures

        private java.util.List<int[]> getCaptures(Piece[][] board,
                                          int[] current)
        Finds all valid moves for the piece at current on board where a piece is captured.
        Parameters:
        board - The board the move should work on.
        current - The position of the piece to be tested. For this method, it does not have to be the current piece. This is done so that it can be called recursively to test for multiple jumps.
        Returns:
        A list of all moves where a piece is captured as coordinates. If there are multiple jumps, each coordinate is appended to the end of the list in order.
